whats the NK function?

--------------------------------------------------------
 k e n n o n  b a l l o u
 msc natural computation : the university of birmingham
 http://studentweb.cs.bham.ac.uk/~msc92klb/
--------------------------------------------------------

On Wed, 12 Nov 2003, Joseph Reisinger wrote:

> > I was wondering if anyone here had thought of or even maybe
> > implemented NEAT for evolving anything non-neural?  (Get it...NEAT
> > without the N is EAT?..ok maybe we need a better acronym!)  Anyway, it
> > is in principle a general topology building algorithm, so it could be
> > interesting in other domains.
>
> When I was writing that modularity overview, I thought it might be nice to
> use something along the lines of NEAT to evolve genotype-phenotype maps.
> I cited a paper by Kvasnicka where they describe a method in which g-p
> maps evolve and modularize forming solutions to the NK function. It might
> beneat to utilize NEAT there (get it), although I'm not sure what
> complexification in the g-p mapping would be defined as.
>
> In general using NEAT to evolve developmental systems would be
> interesting.
>
>
> --
>
> Joseph Reisinger
> http://www.cs.utexas.edu/users/joeraii
